name: Writing Pre-Publishing Checklist Rubric
description: Evaluation criteria for pre-publishing quality check thoroughness

criteria.name: Checklist Completeness
criteria.description: Whether all 6 sections of the checklist were systematically evaluated

scores.1: Fewer than 3 sections evaluated; major gaps in coverage
scores.2: 3-4 sections evaluated; some sections skipped entirely
scores.3: 5 sections evaluated; one section missing or superficial
scores.4: All 6 sections evaluated with clear pass/fail for each item
scores.5: All 6 sections evaluated thoroughly with specific evidence for each pass/fail decision

criteria.name: Issue Identification Accuracy
criteria.description: Whether real issues were caught and false positives avoided

scores.1: Major issues missed; false sense of readiness
scores.2: Some major issues missed; mostly surface-level checks
scores.3: Most issues caught but some significant ones missed
scores.4: Nearly all issues caught with few false positives
scores.5: All genuine issues identified accurately; no significant misses or false alarms

criteria.name: Actionability of Feedback
criteria.description: Whether identified issues are specific enough for the user to fix

scores.1: Issues listed vaguely; user cannot act on them
scores.2: Issues identified but location or fix unclear
scores.3: Issues located with general suggestions for improvement
scores.4: Issues specifically located with clear suggestions for fixing
scores.5: All issues precisely located with specific, actionable fix suggestions and priority ranking

criteria.name: Context Sensitivity
criteria.description: Whether standards were appropriately calibrated to the publication context

scores.1: One-size-fits-all approach; no consideration of context
scores.2: Minimal context consideration; standards too rigid or too loose
scores.3: Some context awareness; mostly appropriate standards
scores.4: Good context calibration; standards match publication type and audience
scores.5: Excellent context awareness; standards perfectly calibrated to audience, format, and publication venue

criteria.name: Read-Aloud and Final Tests
criteria.description: Quality of the final tests including read-aloud simulation and intent verification

scores.2: Cursory final assessment without read-aloud or intent check
scores.3: Basic final tests performed but findings are vague
scores.4: Good final tests; read-aloud issues and intent alignment checked
scores.5: Thorough final tests; read-aloud issues precisely located, intent verified, overall assessment well-reasoned

passing_note: Average score must be >= 3.5 for pre-publishing check to be considered complete. Scores below 3 in 'Issue Identification Accuracy' require re-review.
